page.title: 05Wild Plants in Aldridge
page.content: We decided to find out what sort of plants grow around our school. Two years ago a piece of derelict land was cleared of all plant life, for a spare car park. Now wild plants have started to recolonise it. We surveyed to find what percentage is now covered by plant life and what sort of plants grow there. Our survey showed that in two years 33.9% of the land had been recolonised by plant life. After we had surveyed the area of waste land we went out and studied the species of plant life, 26 in all. Most of the plants were producing flowers. The most popular of all the grasses and flowers was the couch grass. There were four types of grass. Rarest of the plants was a solitary Poppy. A few Birch saplings had rooted. There were also nettles, thistles, dandelions, coltsfoots and many types of vetch.
